Calenzana to Ortu di u Piobbu
itinerary.highlights&Terrain: Steep opening. Massive elevation gain straight from sea level. No warm-up.
Technical ridge walking and boulders. Views of the Cirque de Bonifatu.
Spasimata Bridge (famous suspension bridge). Smooth granite slabs that are slippery when wet.
The Roof of Corsica. Crosses Pointe des Éboulis (2,607m). Variant: Summit Monte Cinto (+2h).

itinerary.route: Tighjettu to Ciottulu di i Mori
itinerary.highlights&Terrain: Shorter day. Passes the Bergerie de Vallone. Beautiful views of Paglia Orba.
Lac de Nino. Wild horses graze around this glacial lake. A long but visually rewarding day.
High ridge walking. Steep climb to Bocca alle Porte with views of Melo and Capitello lakes.
Alpine Variant (ridges) vs. Valley route. The ridge route is spectacular but requires a head for heights.
Descent into the forest. Passes the Cascades des Anglais (waterfalls/pools).
Entering the South. Gentler forest paths under the canopy of Laricio pines.
High-level contouring. Passes through Bocca di Verde. Views of the eastern coastline.
The Knife Edge. A stunning walk along a narrow, rocky spine. One of the most famous sections.
Cuscione Plateau. Lush green meadows, wild pigs, and streams. A very different landscape.
Crossing Monte Incudine (2,134m), the highest point in the South. Expansive 360° views.
Aiguilles de Bavella. Technical "Alpine Variant" (highly recommended) through granite needles.
The victory lap. Descending through pink granite rock and Mediterranean scrub to the finish.
